benchmark_details.name: MELLA (Multilingual Enhancement for Low-resource Language MLLMs)
benchmark_details.overview: MELLA is a multimodal, multilingual dataset designed to enhance both linguistic capability and cultural groundedness for low-resource language models, consisting of 6.8 million image-text pairs tailored for effective MLLM training.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that enhances the performance of multimodal large language models by integrating linguistic capability and cultural knowledge for low-resource languages.

data.source: Curated from native web alt-text and MLLM-generated captions.
data.annotation: Automatically collected and annotated; dual-source approach.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on outputs compared to ground truth annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in generating culturally appropriate and linguistically coherent descriptions.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through experiments across various MLLM architectures.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of performance across various low-resource languages highlighting capability variations.
